newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Ssangyong Motor limit-up on M&A rumours.
newsitem.headline: Ssangyong Motor limit-up on M&A rumours.

text.p: Shares of Ssangyong Motor went limit-up on Wednesday on rumours that upstart carmaker Samsung Motors would be interested in taking over Ssangyong, brokers said.
Ssangyong rose 360 won to its daily upper limit of 4,960.
"The speculation began to flare up as Hyundai and Daewoo's agreement to save Kia Steel dimmed the possibility of Samsung taking over Kia Motors," said Na Min-ho of Daishin Securities.
Brokers said investors appeared to be more optimistic about the future of Ssangyong as the deal between Hyundai, Daewoo and Kia brightened the prospects of an early solution to Kia's problems.
"If Kia can survive, why not Ssangyong?" said Choo Hee-yup of Dongwon Securities. Ssangyong Motor is now saddled with 3.2 trillion won in debts and facing deteriorating earnings.
